page.title: 02 Part of Kettlebrook Valley
page.content: The area studied is 1.5 miles south- east of the centre of Tamworth in Staffordshire. It is bounded by the B5000, the A5(T), Marlborough Way and the remains of Glascote Lane. Farmland and old mine workings in the valley of Kettlebrook have been replaced by planned private and local auhority housing, primary and secondary schools and a park area where shallow mining has made building impossible. The B5000 to the north is now a dual carriageway serving the Amington industrial estate and Marlborough Way provides a north-south road link. The names of new developments reflect former times. Our school, Dumolo's Primary is named after John Dumolo's mine and Bird's Bush Primary after Bird's Bush Cottage which still stands alongside contemporary housing.
